## filterUndefined() function

Creates a parser that discards undefined values from the array produced by the given parser.

Useful in combination with `star`<!-- -->, `or` and `consume`<!-- -->:

```
const a: Parser<string> = token('a');
const b: Parser<void> = consume(token('b'));
const abs: Parser<(string | void)[]> = star(or<string | void>([a, b]));
const as: Parser<string[]> = filterUndefined(abs);
```

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function filterUndefined<T, Input = string>(parser: Parser<(T | void)[], Input>): Parser<T[], Input>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  parser | [Parser](./prsc.parser.md)<!-- -->&lt;(T \| void)\[\], Input&gt; | Parser to apply, should produce an array that may contain undefined entries. |

<b>Returns:</b>

[Parser](./prsc.parser.md)<!-- -->&lt;T\[\], Input&gt;
